event.title: begun by the W. T. Carter & Brother lumber company in the early 1900s

data.event: Camden Texas was a company town begun by the W. T. Carter & Brother lumber company in the early 1900s.

event.title: the sale of the company to Champion Paper in the late 1960s

data.event: After the sale of the company to Champion Paper in the late 1960s, all the public buildings and housing except those owned by Carter Heirs were sold and moved.

event.title: the early 1970s all that was left

data.event: By the early 1970s all that was left was a post office, Champion company offices and a few vacation homes owned by Carters and DeWalch's.
